intro: Rhynchosia minima var. eurycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, edible pods that contain round, kidney-shaped seeds. It is often cultivated for its nutritional value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both agricultural and ecological contexts.
